text:
The imminent need to enhance business processes primarily drives the market. SaaS-based business processes involve help in re-designing processes to add value to the customers. SCM software helps improve efficiency by generating more output using a small amount of input and helps in improving effectiveness by producing products that have higher demand in the market. SaaS-based solutions are set to play a key role in the SCM market over the next four years.

The global SaaS-based supply chain management (SCM) software market is driven by the high demand from SMEs in developing countries. The market environment for SaaS-based SCM continues to improve the availability and use of SaaS-based solutions becomes more prevalent.
Increased market competition and focus by vendors are expected to intensify the development of appropriate and reliable on-demand software over the next four years. Vendors will increasing focus on reducing the initial concerns of end-users about security and availability during the same period.

Leading vendors of SaaS-based SCM
SaaS vendors are providing access to innovative platforms in SaaS-based solutions to meet the growing demand for SCM solutions.
There are a variety of vendors operating in the global SaaS-based SCM market. The market has both SaaS-based and on-premises players and has seen many M&A transactions until 2014. Acquisitions have allowed vendors to expand their SCM capabilities by enhancing warehouse management, order management, cart management, and customer services.
Most vendors are integrating their core SCM products with related products to provide a complete package of SaaS-based solutions. The market is also seeing vast technological changes, due to the demand for omni-channel capabilities in SCM solutions.
